title: Effects of PEMF Treatment on Patients With Mild to Moderate Dementia in a Controlled Pilot Study
description_brief: An open label pilot study in mild to moderate AD/ADRD patients to assess the effects of treatment with ECHS AD/ADRD pulsed electromagnetic treatment device on disease progression. Enrolled patients will receive active devices. They will treat themselves at home three times a day for 15 minutes over 120 days. Primary end point is the The Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive Subscale. Participants will be followed-up for 9 months post-treatment.
drug: ECHS AD Device (pulsed electromagnetic field, PEMF)
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is a pulsed electromagnetic field (PEMF) treatment delivered by the ECHS AD device — a head‑worn electrical/magnetic field applicator intended to alter disease course in mild–moderate dementia. This is a medical device/neuromodulation intervention, not a biologic or small‑molecule drug and not a conventional pharmacologic cognitive enhancer or neuropsychiatric symptom medication. citeturn0search11turn0search1
